meanings.definition: Relating to young people or immature behavior.
meanings.sent1: The juvenile cat played with a ball of yarn.
meanings.sent2: The juvenile behavior of the students disrupted the class.
meanings.sent3: The juvenile squirrel stole all the nuts from the older squirrels.
meanings.sent4: Her juvenile sense of humor always brought laughter to the group.
meanings.sent5: The juvenile plants in the garden needed extra care to grow strong.

meanings.definition: A young person, especially one below the age of legal adulthood.
meanings.sent1: The juvenile was excited to start high school next year.
meanings.sent2: The police officer dealt with the juvenile who had broken curfew.
meanings.sent3: The juvenile at the park was swinging happily on the swings.
meanings.sent4: She always treated her little brother like a juvenile, even though he was growing up fast.
meanings.sent5: The juvenile in the movie had a mischievous twinkle in his eye.
